title: Better handling of `elif -> else if` syntax error

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
if 1 > 2 {
  println!("Hello.");
} elif 2 > 1 {
  println!("Bye.");
}
```


### Current output

```Shell
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: expected one of `!`, `.`, `::`, `;`, `?`, `{`, `}`, or an operator, found `2`
 --> src/main.rs:3:8
  |
3 | } elif 2 > 1 {
  |        ^ expected one of 8 possible tokens

error: could not compile `playground` (bin "playground") due to previous error
```


### Desired output

```Shell
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: expected one of `!`, `.`, `::`, `;`, `?`, `{`, `}`, or an operator, found `2`
 --> src/main.rs:3:8
  |
3 | } elif 2 > 1 {
  |   ---- ^ expected one of 8 possible tokens
  |   |
  |   help: write `else if` instead of `elif`

error: could not compile `playground` (bin "playground") due to previous error
```


### Rationale and extra context

Writing `elif` instead of `else if` would be a very common error for coders coming from Python (or other some languages).

### Other cases

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
